instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD not detect
threads.message:
Hello everybody

I m working on can not detect SSD problem macbook air 13" . Not see liquid damage sign, tested known good two different SSD, cleaned connector with degreaser solution , SSD little warming. 

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL> is ok
Replaced <CHIP>U3710</CHIP> , <CHIP>U3711</CHIP> , <CHIP>U3740</CHIP> nothing changed 

Any idea for next step?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD not detect
threads.message: Check caps in PCIe data lines, probably one chipped off.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD not detect
threads.message: Thank you [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]  replaced all caps on data line and re-solder SSD connector its working :cool:
